DataElement.preferredName: Standard Uptake Value F-18 16 Alpha-Fluoroestradiol Maximum Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to capture the maximum standard uptake value for F-18 16 Alpha-Fluoroestradiol (FES), a positron-emitting radiopharmaceutical which is actively taken up in tumor cells expressing the estrogen receptor (ER), thereby allowing visualization of ER-positive cells . [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Standard Uptake Value F-18 16 Alpha-Fluoroestradiol Maximum Value
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to capture the maximum standard uptake value for F-18 16 Alpha-Fluoroestradiol (FES), a positron-emitting radiopharmaceutical which is actively taken up in tumor cells expressing the estrogen receptor (ER), thereby allowing visualization of ER-positive cells . [Manually-curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Regularly and widely used.:No value exists.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.:A radiopharmaceutical containing an estradiol analog radiolabeled with fluorine F 18, a positron emitting isotope, used as a tracer in positron emission tomography (PET). F-18 16 alpha-fluoroestradiol is actively taken up in tumor cells expressing the estrogen receptor (ER), thereby allowing visualization of ER-positive cells upon PET. The uptake of F-18 16 alpha-fluoroestradiol is dependent upon changes in ER levels in the target tissue.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

A radiopharmaceutical consisting of an estradiol analogue radiolabeled with the positron-emitting isotope fluorine F 18. F-18 16 alpha-fluoroestradiol is actively taken up in tumor cells expressing the estrogen receptor (ER), allowing visualization of ER-positive tumor cells with positron emission tomography (PET). Uptake of this agent depends upon the ER status of target tissues.
